p: A. muricata has been extensively investigated for its diverse pharmacological aspects possessed by crude leaf extracts and found eminent for treating diverse maladies most critically being cancer [ 5, 6]. According to literature, 117 isolates of secondary metabolites comprised mainly of alkaloids, annonaceous acetogenins, megastigmanes, and phenolic compounds are reported in leaves. However, this plant grown under different cultivations does not necessarily exhibit the same phytochemistry with curative benefits [ 7â€“9].
